item.title: No litter bins that are needed., 18th July
item.description:
Dear Sir\Madam Sometime ago the litter bin was taken from the bus stop( 0106 0262) which is just passed Brackley Road coming from Beckenham. This has since not been replaced. Please can we have another litter bin positioned by the bus stop as people are throwing there rubbish over the metal fence into the Estate. Also the Bus Stop(0106 1235) which is almost opposite does not have a litter bin. Again, this was taken away sometime ago and has not been replaced.It would be good to place one there. Many thanks David Muxworthy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southend Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree need pruning, 18th July
item.description:

item.title: Fridge Freezer Dumped Here, 18th July
item.description:
Hello , This fridge freezer has been dumped here for a few weeks now . You can not see it unless you are overlooking it from the back which is where my house is. The fridge freezer is down Thorne Close where the garages are situated . Thank you ....

item.title: Parking on Zebra crossing zig-zags, 18th July
item.description:
Every day cars and vans park on the zig-zags on the Zebra crossing (deliberately avoiding the double yellows), treating them as free parking zones. They are parked all doay for hours on end with no seemingly no enforcement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Middlesex Street, Whitechapel, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Glebe, Camberwell, London

item.title: Casualty from scaffolding falling, 18th July
item.description:
At 1pm today, metal part of the scaffolding has fallen onto a resident in front of the entrance. He has now been sent to the hospital for his injuries. This is the scaffolding put up for the cladding that broke, as reported in FixMyStreet ref: 6826268
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Provost Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
